Package ohos.sensor.agent

Class SensorAgent<S extends SensorBase,D extends SensorData<S>,L extends ISensorDataCallback<D,S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.sensor.agent.SensorAgent<S,D,L>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - Indicates a sensor.
    D - Indicates sensor data.
    L - Indicates the callback for receiving sensor data.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CategoryBodyAgent, CategoryEnvironmentAgent, CategoryLightAgent, CategoryMotionAgent, CategoryOrientationAgent, CategoryOtherAgent

    public abstract class SensorAgent<S extends SensorBase,D extends SensorData<S>,L extends ISensorDataCallback<D,S>>
extends Object
    An abstract base class that manages sensors on hardware devices.

    This class abstracts sensors on hardware devices and provides abstract methods.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Sensors#SENSOR

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int SENSOR_CATEGORY_BODY
      Describes body sensors.
      static int SENSOR_CATEGORY_DEVICEMOTION
      Describes motion sensors of devices.

      Describes environment sensors.

      Describes light sensors.

      Describes orientation sensors.

      Describes other sensors.
      static int SENSOR_SAMPLING_RATE_FASTEST
      Indicates the fastest sampling rate for obtaining sensor data.
      static int SENSOR_SAMPLING_RATE_GAME
      Indicates the sampling rate for obtaining sensor data in gaming scenarios.
      static int SENSOR_SAMPLING_RATE_NORMAL
      Indicates the default sampling rate for obtaining sensor data, for example, in screen rotation scenarios.
      static int SENSOR_SAMPLING_RATE_UI
      Indicates the sampling rate for obtaining sensor data on UIs.
      static String STRING_SENSOR_CATEGORY_BODY
      Describes body sensors using a string of characters.
      static String STRING_SENSOR_CATEGORY_DEVICEMOTION
      Describes motion sensors using a string of characters.
      static String STRING_SENSOR_CATEGORY_ENVIRONMENT
      Describes environment sensors using a string of characters.
      static String STRING_SENSOR_CATEGORY_LIGHT
      Describes light sensors using a string of characters.
      static String STRING_SENSOR_CATEGORY_ORIENTATION
      Describes orientation sensors using a string of characters.
      static String STRING_SENSOR_CATEGORY_OTHER
      Describes sensors in the other category (a category other than motion, environment, orientation, light, and body) using a string of characters.

    • Method Detail

      • subscribeParamsCheck

        protected boolean subscribeParamsCheck​(L callback,
                                       S sensor,
                                       long interval,
                                       long maxDelay)
        Checks the validity of subscription parameters.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback for receiving the sensor data.
        sensor - Indicates the sensor for which the callback is to be set.
        interval - Indicates the sampling interval, in nanoseconds.
        maxDelay - Indicates the maximum latency for the sensor to report events to the application, in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the input parameters are valid; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

        Returns a list of sensors of the specified category.

      • getAllSensors

        Returns:
        Returns a list of sensors of the specified type.
        Since:

      • getSingleSensor

        public abstract S getSingleSensor​(int sensorType)
        Obtains the default sensor of a specified type in a sensor category.

        The default sensor is the first sensor of a specified type in a sensor category.

        Parameters:
        sensorType - Indicates a type in the sensor category.
        Returns:
        Returns the default sensor of a specified type in the sensor category.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getAllSensors(), getAllSensors(int)

      • setSensorDataCallback

        public abstract boolean setSensorDataCallback​(L callback,
                                              S sensor,
                                              long interval,
                                              long maxDelay)
        Sets a callback for a sensor to receive the sensor data at a specified sampling interval based on the maximum event reporting latency.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to set for receiving sensor data. If this parameter is null, setting the callback fails.
        sensor - Indicates the sensor for which the callback is to be set. If this parameter is null, setting the callback fails.
        interval - Indicates the sampling interval, in nanoseconds. The sampling interval may vary depending on the sensor type. You can use the SensorBase.getMinInterval() and SensorBase.getMaxInterval() methods to obtain the minimum sampling interval and maximum sampling interval of the sensor, respectively, and then set the value of this parameter in between. If the configured parameter value is smaller than the minimum sampling interval of the sensor, the minimum sampling interval is used. If the configured parameter value is larger than the maximum sampling interval of the sensor, the maximum sampling interval is used.
        maxDelay - Indicates the maximum latency for the sensor to report events to the application in nanoseconds, based on the first in first out (FIFO) policy of the hardware. The maximum latency may vary depending on the sensor.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback is set successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setSensorDataCallback

        public abstract boolean setSensorDataCallback​(L callback,
                                              S sensor,
                                              int mode)
        Sets a callback for a sensor to receive sensor data in a specified sampling mode.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to set for receiving sensor data. If this parameter is null, setting the callback fails.
        sensor - Indicates the sensor for which the callback is to be set. If this parameter is null, setting the callback fails.
        mode - Indicates the sampling mode. Each sampling mode represents a sampling rate, including the fastest sampling rate, sampling rate in gaming scenarios, sampling rate on UIs, and default sampling rate. For example, you can set the fastest sampling rate of the sensor via SensorAgent#SENSOR_SAMPLING_RATE_FASTEST.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback is set successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setSensorDataCallback

        public abstract boolean setSensorDataCallback​(L callback,
                                              S sensor,
                                              int mode,
                                              long maxDelay)
        Sets a callback for a sensor to receive sensor data in a specified sampling mode based on the maximum event reporting latency.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to set for receiving sensor data. If this parameter is null, setting the callback fails.
        sensor - Indicates the sensor for which the callback is to be set. If this parameter is null, setting the callback fails.
        mode - Indicates the sampling mode. Each sampling mode represents a sampling rate, including the fastest sampling rate, sampling rate in gaming scenarios, sampling rate on UIs, and default sampling rate. For example, you can set the fastest sampling rate of the sensor via SensorAgent#SENSOR_SAMPLING_RATE_FASTEST.
        maxDelay - Indicates the maximum latency (in nanoseconds) for the sensor to report events to the application, based on the first in first out (FIFO) policy of the hardware. The maximum latency may vary depending on the sensor.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback is set successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • releaseSensorDataCallback

        public abstract boolean releaseSensorDataCallback​(L callback,
                                                  S sensor)
        Releases the callback for a sensor.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback set for receiving sensor data. If this parameter is null, releasing the callback fails.
        sensor - Indicates the sensor for which the callback is to be released. If this parameter is null, the callback of all sensors in the category will be released.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback is released successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • releaseSensorDataCallback

        public abstract boolean releaseSensorDataCallback​(L callback)
        Releases the callback for all sensors.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback set for receiving sensor data. If this parameter is null, releasing the callback fails.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback is released successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getSensorMinSampleInterval

        public long getSensorMinSampleInterval​(int sensorId)
        Queries the minimum sampling interval of a sensor.

        You can query this value and set the sampling interval accordingly.

        Parameters:
        sensorId - Indicates the ID of a sensor. You can use the SensorBase.getSensorId() method to obtain the sensor ID.
        Returns:
        Returns the minimum sampling interval of the sensor.
        Since:
        1

      • runCommand

        public int runCommand​(int sensorId,
                      int commandType,
                      int commandParameter)
        Executes the specified command for a sensor based on the given parameter.
        Parameters:
        sensorId - Indicates the ID of a sensor. You can use the SensorBase.getSensorId() method to obtain the sensor ID.
        commandType - Indicates the type of the command to execute. SensorBase defines the constants to store the command types. For example, you can pass SensorBase.COMMAND_TYPE_FLUSH to this parameter to flush data.
        commandParameter - Indicates the parameter of the command to execute. SensorBase defines the constants to store the command parameters. For example, you can pass SensorBase.COMMAND_PARAMETER_FLUSH to this parameter to flush data.
        Returns:
        Returns the command execution result.
        Since:
        3
